author: Dan Verowski
title: Strengthen local communities
description: How to generate more active Cardano participants, that effect local change?Many don't know how to use a Cardano wallet & need face2face help

assessments.note: To me this proposal seems rough around the edges. Although the requested funds are relatively small, it still does not seem sufficiently well presented. The proposed solution seems to be based on a donation model [ Give away for a couple of Ada. People come, setup wallet, receive Ada and "pay" for product. ]. Narrowly speaking it does provide help to a very small subset in a local community (consumers and sellers of a certain product), but does it automatically translate into " strengthening the community", apart from the proposed transactions? It does certainly help to implement the transactions as long as there is funding for the donations, but does it really further adoption after the initial donation is spent? Apart from the donated ADA, I am not convinced that it will result in the creation of a LCC - Business center (solving a local problem) that is sustainable - based on Cardano.

The described approach would help to spread the word about Cardano but I don't see how this would lead to strenthing local communities. It seems more like a way to bring attendance to the company of the author.
So the plan is to give people ADA that they can then give to you and you give them some alchemy in the bottle? I'm sorry... what?

The idea in general is good, although it will have a relatively low impact and we think in the whole ecosystem and local communities centers, but I believe that some interested people could start their 'crypto life' by this initiative. Some suggestions are: change 5 ADA to the equivalent price of the bottle, since we don't know how much one ADA will cost by the time this is implemented; also, I don't see a need to create a event specific wallet, maybe Yoroi could be used for this.
that will attract more scammer , ada giveaway !!

There is no description of how the proposal will address the challenge in a relevant way. The idea presented is to to ADA giveaways to encourage people to use the wallet, there is no mention of a Community Center.
It is a very simple proposal with a very simple solution, i am not sure if it is needed to address the challenge as the challenge itself isn't very concrete

The plan is limited in scope and seems it could be implemented, on the face of it. But, at the same time the issue I have with the likelihood of successful implementation is the lack of details about the proposer and the nature of the proposer's links to the local businesses that are being mentioned, as well as their true interest for participating. My impression is there is not sufficient information to convince me of the likelihood for a successful implementation.
Giving away some adas wouldn't be a big challenge. The wallet creation process must be explained but I'm pretty sure, this will be managed.
Umm, I am super confused about this proposal. Tokenizing a bottle sounds like fun though. Perhaps tokenized bottles wouldn't be thrown away so easily.

Proposal is relatively simple to implement, which is very good. Not a lot of experience would be needed. I'm not sure if the proposer is somehow related to the mentioned store (Aramen), but even if it is, I don't see if as a problem.
they are enough fake ada giveway we don't want to give them a legit appearance

Although the idea is extremely simple, the plan is not clear. What is the purpose to create a specific wallet? How does this idea involve Community Centers? There is no information about the proposer experience and its qualifications.
Although detail of plan is suggested i don't see any guarantee of how it can be implemented as organised.

I found myself desiring much more information about the proposal's feasibility and more data on how it addresses the challenge in question. I was not convinced about the true merits and feasibility of the proposal from the available information.
The challenge is not really solved by the suggested measures but I think that the succested measures can be implemented by the proposer.
I'm curious to know: what exactly will you get with that 1,337 USD? It's a very specific sum.

In this case, I don't see need for roadmap and milestones, since it is a very simple proposal, but KPIs need to be included. I believe a single KPI should be use most of the requested fund to distribute amongst new participants. Auditability could be done by tracking new generated wallets and the ADA transactions related to the proposal.

The idea doesn't address Community Centers. There is not enough information to check the feasibility. I recommend that the proposal be rewritten based on the Catalyst guidelines/documentation and be submitted in an appropriate challenge.
there are perhaps too little information provided.

solution: Give away for a couple of Ada. People come, setup wallet, receive Ada and "pay" for product. strengthens local business & wins participants.
